oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Political cartoon, "The Destiny of a Nation"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Editorial cartoon shows Uncle Sam standing in a hand representing the Supreme Court. Uncle Sam holds a large scroll labeled "New Deal." The cartoon is pasted in a scrapbook signed by Tennessean cartoonist Joe Parrish, but the cartoon identifies the artist as Cross.

President Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal provided plenty of fodder for editorial cartoonists. Early on conservatives were alarmed by what they considered the establishment of a welfare state. Conservative justices struck down a number of FDR's signature "alphabet agencies," including the AAA (Agricultural Adjustment Act) and the NRA (National Recovery Act).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Deal, 1933-1939--Tennessee ; Political cartoons
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cross
